title: incr.comp.: Do not hard-wire DepGraph into Session and CrateStore.
body:
In the current setup, we create the `DepGraph` [very early](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/d7d75eff30ff03f607ff0656a50f4be768cfdbc9/src/librustc_driver/lib.rs#L296), so it can be put into the `CrateStore` and the `Session` object. This means that we construct the `DepGraph` long before we have enough information to know where to load the previous `DepGraph` from and, because the `CrateStore` is used very early too, we are registering dep-nodes and edges before the graph is fully operational. This is ugly but harmless in the current implementation. In the new tracking system it would become a problem.

So the plan is to construct the `DepGraph` only when we can already load the previous `DepGraph`. This needs some refactoring:
- [x] Remove the `dep_graph` field from `Session`, - #44502
- [x] Remove the `dep_graph` field from `CStore` and don't do any dependency tracking in the regular `CStore` implementation. - #44418
- [x] Make sure that we *do* perform dependency tracking for anything within the query system, via a tasteful blend of: - #44142 and #44420
  - [x] creating a `CrateStore` wrapper that does dependency tracking and make only that available via `tcx.cstore()`, and - #44142
  - [x] making all `CrateStore` access go through queries. - #44142
- [x] Adapt `librustc_incremental::persist::fs::prepare_session_directory()` to not need the `tcx` and invoke it [right after parsing, when we know the definitive crate name](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/d7d75eff30ff03f607ff0656a50f4be768cfdbc9/src/librustc_driver/driver.rs#L142). - #44502
- [x] Move `DepGraph` construction to right after `librustc_incremental::persist::fs::prepare_session_directory()` has been called. - #44502

Any work in this direction will want to be based on top of ~~https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/44341~~ the master branch.
